alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 8:44PM CDT until May 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Dakota, Carver, Scott and Hennepin Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. .Additional rainfall over the last 24 hours has kept river levels in flood stage, with a gradual decrease over the next week. With thunderstorms in the forecast by the end of the weekend, this will have to be monitored closely. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading stops at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 703.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Wednesday was 703.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday evening and continue falling to 698.4 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 703.4 feet on 06/29/2011. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
